main event: A round reddish orange ball was observed in flight from the east to the north at Beaver Falls, Pennsylvania on July 13, 1963.
interesting points: The object was visible for approximately 1.5 seconds., The sighting occurred in dark conditions., The witness noted that the object seemed to have stopped burning before disappearing., The witness was sitting on his porch when he first noticed the object., The sighting's altitude was estimated to be around 30,000 feet during disappearance.
witness description: The primary observer was a chemical engineer from Beaver Falls, PA, and his wife also witnessed the object.
